text: Lunch set. Moderate pricing compared to other fine dining choices. Good options available for each course . Service professional and warm with a pleasant ambience. Been there several times and food is always consistently good although with some updates to the menu.

The place shifted to Keong Saik from circular road and has been around
For ages.
The kitchen is now helmed by a very young but exciting chef. The cuisine is modern French Japanese fusion. Try their tasting menu which is a reasonable $148++ which includes 5 courses. Trust me itâ€™s filling. The sommen and abalone risotto was really well executed. Loved the sauce that came with the asparagus. Sour dough is provided for u to lap up the sauce. Wines are reasonable for pairing.
Good place to Relak. Worth a return.

We had an amazing meal at Mag's and felt so welcomed from the moment we stepped in! All the dishes were exquisite and had an Asian touch and flair to it that made it so unique and special.

Standouts were the steak tartare that was so refreshing, not at all gamey. The somen texture was amazing and the sauce coated every strand evenly. The crispy sakura ebi and soft sweet ebi tartare provided the perfect textual contrast to the chewy noodles. Our favourite was definitely the pan seared pearl grouper. The sauce that came with it was impeccable!! Extremely rich yet not fishy at all. We mopped up every bit of it.

Thanks Mag and her team for making our date night so memorable ðŸ˜Š
Excellent service, food and atmosphere! Enjoyed each dish. Was really happy with the seafood theme that I had that night. They also gave me a free yuzu sorbet as a birthday dessert. Nice gesture!

The beef was cooked absolutely on point. I am not a lover of medium rare beef but my perspective had changed entirely.

Scallops Ceviche was a absolute crowd pleaser. Fresh and a palette cleanser.

The desert caps off the evening. It is so good that we had two portions. Strawberry was fresh and lightly tart. The sweetness level was precise and not overly sweet.
